III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency did not submit any corrective action plans during this licensing
period.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator Annual Assessment was reviewed. The 2021 renewal did
not have any violations. The Administrator reported that LAS has followed
recommendations and procedural changes presented by MCI and the Adoption
Assistance office. The agency identified and continued some innovations,
necessitated by the pandemic, such as virtual orientations, trainings, and virtual
therapeutic support interventions which allowed some families more direct access to
information and support. The agency recognized their local court jurisdictions have
had resultant delays in their ability to best support timely adoption permanency. Over
the course of the last two years some local courts have, at times, not been able to
accept packets ready to be filed and have had less openings to schedule adoption
hearings. Regardless, LAS continues to push hard to achieve timely permanency for
children and solutions to reduce barriers that threaten to delay permanency.
Interviews:
4

One adoption worker was interviewed. She reported she has worked for the agency
for several years. The worker reported she enjoyed her job and she receive support
from her direct supervisor and her coworkers. She reported feeling very supported by
her administration. She did not express any areas in which she feels the agency
could improve upon.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that Lutheran Adoption Services continue on a regular license.
